channel.title: DND 5th Edition - new forum posts
channel.description: Posts in forums of the site "DND 5th Edition" - community wiki

item.title: Re: Wonders of the Multiverse UA
item.content:encoded:
Thanks for working on this! All the finished pages have been linked on the main page.

I'm going to be out of town all week next week so I went ahead and added links to all the unfinished pages as well (all feats I think). Once those pages are created the links should start working. Just double check the link you create it at with the link on the main page. If it's created correctly the link should change from gray to gold-ish (whatever color most of the links on the main page are).


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Wonders of the Multiverse UA

item.title: Siege Equipment and Poisons
item.content:encoded:
Alongside the other things to work on, I've decided to quickly take some time to add Siege Equipment and Poisons to the site, which are from the DMG, since I do believe that, while they are rare, they definitely fall under the range of player usable items in the same way wondrous items and such are

Siege equipment is complete, and at the exact moment of writing this I haven't started the poisons page.

http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/siege-equipment
http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/poisons


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Siege Equipment and Poisons

item.title: The wording on the page for Mace of Terror is a bit off
item.content:encoded:
Hi,

I noticed a repeat in the description paragraph for Mace of Terror.

It says "Each creature of your choice in a 30-foot radius extending from you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you for 1 minute. While it is frightened of you for 1 minute. While it is frightened in this way, a creature must spend its turns trying to move as far away from you as it can […]"


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: The wording on the page for Mace of Terror is a bit off

item.title: Re: UA-work
item.content:encoded:
Alright, thing to bring up.
So, along the way of double checking, ive mostly been ignoring subclasses and such that have similiarly named ones, however, today I made this page: http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/monk:kensai-ua, due to the fact that I feel that this UA version of Kensai is different enough from the print kensai to make it worth having a page for.

So, with that, I've decided ill probably give a double check over everything ive already checked to triple check, this time for how different a subclass is from ones we already have, since for an example we have on the website: Soulknife rogue. Soulknife UA, Soulknife UA revised, and Soulknife tasha's are all very similiar, but they are all different enough to warrent the seperate pages.

So yeah oops, there goes me having to recheck most things ough


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: UA-work

item.title: Re: UA-work
item.content:encoded:
Lets see.

1. Thanks for putting Ambuscade up there
2. Ah, thanks for fixing up wild shape forms, yeah my coding continues to be rather rough, and I sometimes leave the tabs in when I transfer stuff in from the PDF's, ill make sure to avoid those being there in future.
3. Yeah, I think that would be good, having it as "Guided Character Creation"
4. I think just listing them in the same bullet points as the subclasses would be ok? Since, thats what is done for the rangers alternate versions of itself (with then its own subclasses dropped in in sub-bullet points)?

Thanks for helping with the code and frontpage Fred!


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: UA-work

item.title: Re: UA-work
item.content:encoded:
So few things…

1. Ambuscade Ranger has been added to the archived UA section of the main page.
2. Wild Shape Forms, I renamed it slightly to druid:wild-shape-forms-ua and cleaned up the coding behind the scenes, had tabs everywhere instead of spaces lol
3. For the UA quick characters, we can certainly add that to the section for Heroic Chronicle, maybe rename that section to Guided Character Creation or something like that? What do you think?
4. I'm not sure if or where to add the Wild Shape Forms or UA Invocations on the main page. I'm hesitant to put them under the main class section, but the archived UA is mostly set up for subclasses, not class features. I'll think on that, see what I can come up with.

Thanks for all the work NCat!


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: UA-work

item.title: UA-work
item.content:encoded:
Im mostly using this thread as a way to track progress as I go through each UA to ensure we have its contents up on the wikidot (thank you very much cotteneyenoh for the checklist <333 http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/forum/t-14715608/errata-checklist), since yeah, I find having a discussion forum helps with me tracking my work.

First up out of order is UA warlock and wizard's Eldritch Invocations, which we dont have, despite having the ravenqueen warlock from said UA.

Though, I'm thinking with this, since there are about 60 Eldritch invocations at present on the wikidot, and there are 20+ invocations in this UA, that I feel I'm going to start by migrating the current UA invocations to a /warlock:eldritch-invocations-UA link, so as to better distinguish them, and then link the UA ones in the top of the warlock page, and then someone with front page perms can add them below the warlocks Archived UA section

edit: Oh! And this does actually open up the window to creating similiar pages for Homebrew invocations from the list of homebrew creators we list. Same goes infusions too I believe, meaning I might add an equivilant page, since I know that Exploring Ebberon had a couple of infusions in there


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: UA-work

item.title: DMG Races
item.content:encoded:
With the work towards finalizing and front-page-ifying the new lineages pages, I got thinking towards something I loosely remembered, and, today had found it:

The DMG has in it, a bunch of additional, non standard races. These include things such as gnolls, zombies, skeletons and grimlocks.

So, I'm wondering what peoples thoughts are towards them, and whether they should be added.

On one opinion, they are listed as NPC races, and the book in discussing them describes them as intended to be used for DM's making NPC's (Some of the races on that same list already had player races, but the NPC race version of them exists as a simplified form of them). So, odds are these weren't really made with players in mind (and well, items such as the skeleton have stats such as +1+2-6-4-4 in their arrays)

On the other hand, the Oathbreaker Paladin and the Death Cleric are also DMG subclasses, and they are listed on the wikidot.

But then, against that argument, is the fact the DMG does go out of its way to discuss these races as player options

So yeah, I wanted to hear other people heres thoughts on it. Personally, on one hand, they are race options in an official WoTC book, but on the other, they most definitely do not feel like they are designed for players (as can tell with things like abilities that are +1 to hit all attacks, which work for NPCs, but not players), and they are also sorta hidden in the book.

If we did add them, I feel we'd need to go out of our way somewhere to point out that they would be very, very non standard, (probably more so than the homebrew we list on the wikidot even), since I feel theyd need a bit of context to explain them, and I wouldn't want to have a new player who uses the site use them without said knowledge

Plus, it does feel aimed at DMs, so it might not match the wikidots usual "player focused" attitude.

Yeah, that about sums it up for me. Just wanted to bring them up for the sake of discussion and so as that we were all aware of them if we were not already

Oh, if you want to take a look at the races yourself, they're on the table on page 282 of the DMG


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: DMG Races

item.content:encoded:
Sure thing! Sorry about not linking them in threads, I was attempting to experiment with a way to format collaborative work, though yeah I can see if this is a bit rougher to work with for importing into the site. If I do such a thing in future, Ill remember to put the links onto the discussion forums as well once the work has been completed

Welcome back Fred, good to see you. No worries on the delay, everyone gets like that from time to time I think? Its just nice to see you're still out and about


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Unearthed Arcana: Giant Options

item.title: Re: monsters
item.content:encoded:
I believe the core reasons monsters haven't been added is that, the wikidot is (at least in my own eyes, others here might have a different input) designed with a player focus, rather than a DM one, so each resource here would be something a player might need to reference in game / use in character creation.

A majority of the time, monsters are going to be used by the DM, rather than the player (with the most probable exception of Druids and some spells)

Admittedly, it is a bit annoying to not have the animals you wish to wildshape/summon be available on the wikidot, but yeah…

Thats sorta the idea behind my own thinking. Though once again, others on the team might have different reasons


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: monsters

item.title: monsters
item.content:encoded:
I was wondering if there was a particular reason why monsters aren't available here? this would complete this perfect resource.


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: monsters

item.title: Re: Should the wiki change from Race to Lineage?
item.content:encoded:
This is something actually in the works on the wikidot, it just hasn't made its way to the front page yet (though, it is on the http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/home:test page)

http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/lineage

Heres a link to the current iteration of the lineages page. In future, all races will have "lineage:xxx" in their link.

Putting a paragraph like that might be a bit much for every page, but putting down that optional rule somewhere in the greater lineage page at some point could be a good idea


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Should the wiki change from Race to Lineage?

item.title: Should the wiki change from Race to Lineage?
item.content:encoded:
In Tasha's Cauldron of Everything WotC started to make the change for 5e to have Race change to Lineage for a more of the times wording. Also they are moving to make all the Lineages have stat increases that are choices. What do you all think about changing the wiki pages proactively? I personally have been running my games where the stat increases are choices anyway, but should the wiki reflect the ASI paragraph on page 7 of TCoE?
I think that the Wiki pages should have a paragraph on the top of every Lineage page that says something along the lines of "the ASI, Proficiency, and Languages are optional. TCoE states that you can chose what would best fit your character"
Thoughts??


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Should the wiki change from Race to Lineage?

Though, it does make me also consider at some point in future like, setting up a 5ewikidot discord server or something that has a link to such a document, as well as chats to help us communicate in a bit of a less fancy format, though I don't know if people here would want or need such a thing

but yeah, once again, thanks very much so cottoneyenoh

item.title: Re: Errata Checklist
item.content:encoded:
put this together a few days ago. not sure how in depth we wanted to go, but for completeness sake i put in a general sheet for every piece of published content (except errata yet cause idk if we wanna put it by item being errata-d or each entry on sage advice or whatever) and examples of how we could do individual items for the Lost Mine of Phandelver and the Player's Handbook. here's the link:

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1cyoji01XRn2fm7LPS0CbCSx2x4SGMqmo6sWWsryzn-U/edit?usp=sharing

i made it so anyone with the link above can make comments, but i think that dming me/whoever's making the complete sheet and them giving editor access would be an easy way to do it, esp since it's easy to see who makes what edits so any vandalism can be easily tracked down, undone, and dealt with. let me know what you think and we should have a good checklist for stuff to do moving forwards


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Errata Checklist

Forum category: Community / Open Topic

item.title: Re: Errata Checklist
item.content:encoded:
id be happy to have a pinned checklist of things to do, either contained in the pinned thread or having the pinned thread lead to google doc/sheets links. only thing i'd say is that we should have any google docs we make be comment-only for anyone but their creator to avoid vandalism (i was gonna say griefing but idk what word best applies lol. basically we don't want people to be dicks and screw up any documentation we've got, but comments would allow the page's creator to review and approve as applicable).

i can throw together a basic google sheet with the list of published content as a checklist to make sure we've gone over everything, including UA, errata, etc. i'm not sure how to pin a thread, but i'll either figure it out or wait for fredbob or another admin to do so if it's an admin-only action


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Errata Checklist

Yeah, alrighty

item.title: Re: Corrections
item.content:encoded:
On the Barbarian: Path of the Ancestral Guardian page, the Spirit Shield ability only applies to other creatures, and should read "If you are raging and another creature you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage…" instead of "If you are raging and a creature you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage…"

Also, two minor inconsistencies with the Ancestral Protectors ability's text compared to the book:
It has slightly different text in last sentence "that creature has resistance to the damage of the target’s attacks", vs the book's "that creature has resistance to the damage dealt by the attack"
The ability is also missing the final sentence of "The effect on the target ends early if your rage ends." (it is redundant, since the ability already states "While you're raging", but I imagine it should be consistent with the book anyway)


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Corrections

item.title: Re: Exploring Eberron and Homebrew Races
item.content:encoded:
Id be interested in seeing them make an appearance in the homebrew section, which doesnt have yet but could hold a homebrew races section. The aasimar subraces would need their own unique homebrew-ebberon page most likely, since putting them on the regular aasimar page would probably cause confusion to newer players who might think its base game

but yeah, im in favor of adding them, might get around to creating pages if I find the moment to do so in my day


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Exploring Eberron and Homebrew Races

item.title: Exploring Eberron and Homebrew Races
item.content:encoded:
Heyo, I was recently looking through the Exploring Eberron book, and I know that the homebrew subclasses are added onto here, but I was wondering if there would be a chance to add the homebrew races as well? Such as the Gnoll, and extra subraces for Aasimar and etc. It would be cool to see them on here, but i understand if not. Thanks for y'all time!


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Exploring Eberron and Homebrew Races

item.title: Re: Equipment and Items
item.content:encoded:
Absolutely awesome, thank you so much for the fast and kind response. If me or my group notices anything I'll be sure to post about it.


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Equipment and Items

item.title: Re: Equipment and Items
item.content:encoded:
Thanks for the suggestion! I honestly didn't realize we didn't have descriptions of the equipment packs until reading this, and they should definitely be included. As such, I've reformatted the Adventuring Gear page (which you can normally find under the Items tab on the front page) to include the contents of the different equipment packs available, as well as adding descriptions to items from the PHB where applicable.

Let us know if there's other things you'd like to see on the wiki!


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Equipment and Items

item.title: Re: Corrections
item.content:encoded:
That's not a typo, that's the wording in Xanathar's. "Starting at 3rd level, you can focus your ire on one foe, increasing the harm you inflict on it." Ire as in anger/wrath


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Corrections

item.title: Equipment and Items
item.content:encoded:
Hello, new user here love how usefully this page is. I was wondering if tables and descriptions will be added for equipment. For example some classes start with a "dungeoneer’s pack", but there's no table or description about what's in that pack. Sure it's easy to google, but just wondering if that'll be something to get added?


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Equipment and Items

item.title: Re: Corrections
item.content:encoded:
on the Ranger Monster Slayer Conclave page the Slayer's Prey has a typo. It says "Starting at 3rd level, you can focus your ire" not focus your fire.

item.title: Re: Lineage Pages for MMotM
item.content:encoded:
Of course! And speaking of, the lineage page is now fully updated and contains links to all current lineages/races/subraces/etc. We may reformat the page to just have the main links to the lineages (for example, a single link to the Aasimar page rather than have links 5 for the VGM aasimar, each of the 3 VGM subraces, and the MMotM aasimar), but past that and some simple editing of individual pages, we should be able to incorporate it into the front page for everyone to access!


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Lineage Pages for MMotM

item.title: Heroes of Krynn Revisited UA
item.content:encoded:
This new UA is basically revising elements from the last one. I'll be combing through it over the next few days, either making updates to current pages or making new ones if the changes are significant enough. I'll post any new pages or note any changes here.
